data.name: label1.Text
data.value:
File options: Both entries under file open new windows to complete their respective tasks, preparing a list of monsters or players for future sessions. To use these, simply enter the information of the Monsters along with their Initiative bonuses. To move between Name and Initiative boxes press ‘Enter’ when selected on the Initiative box this also functions to create an additional Monster. Save – Opens a Dialog box to save the Encounter as a csv file Clear – Removes all Monsters, useful for when preparing multiple encounters Remove Last – Didn’t like that monster choice? Accidentally hit ‘Enter’ one too many times? This is your button my friend. When done, simply close out of the box.
Load Fighters: When the Session has arrived, and your players are ready to play, click this! It opens a box to load the csv files we saved earlier. If done correctly the names of the monsters and players should appear under the “In Fight” column.
Options: This application was built with my group’s DM in mind. In our group we roll once per round and he doesn’t mind that the application rolls monsters initiatives. By checking on or both of the boxes you can changes these options to suit your own playstyle.
Help: You’re already here dummy! If you want to ask questions you know where to find me (hopefully). Any and all feedback is appreciated, now onto the goodstuff.
Main Form: In Fight: This column is a list that will always keep track of who is currently engaged in combat. If a monster or player (oh no!) dies simply click the button with their name on it. This will remove them from the next roll for initiative.
Name/Initative: These columns serve a dual purpose. When rolling for initiative, they are used for ease of looking at when inputting rolls. After initiative is done, they become unclickable “labels”.
Add Fighter: A surprise addition to a fight? I’ve got you covered. The two textboxes above must both be filled with a name, and either number (if it’s a monster) or ‘p’, for player. Once the button has been pressed or ‘Enter’ in the Initiative textbox, the slate is clean, and the new fighter is added to the roster.
Roll for Initiative!: As simple as it sounds, once all fighters are on the field, press this simple button, and prepare to receive rolls from the players.
Next Turn: This button is inert, until everything is prepared, but moves initiative in order.
Finalize: Although currently invisible, once the “Roll for Initiative” button has been pressed, it appears. Either press it or ‘Enter’ on the last textbox in the Initiative column to cycle over to actual combat.
